headlines: Partha Chatterjee's arrest brought shame, disgrace to all of us: TMC spokesperson
text: Commenting on West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest in teachers recruitment scam, Trinamool Congress (TMC) spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said he has brought "shame and disgrace to all of us". "This proves the level of corruption in TMC and the government," he added. "Chatterjee is saying why he would quit...Why isn't he saying in the public he is innocent?" Ghosh questioned.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, arrested in SSC recruitment scam, sacked
text: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in the alleged SSC recruitment scam, has been relieved of his duties as the minister in charge of various departments in the state. This comes after the ED said it has seized ₹50 crore in cash and gold jewellery from houses belonging to Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Congress MP Adhir calls President Murmu 'Rashtrapatni', BJP MPs protest in Parliament
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury referred to President Droupadi Murmu as 'Rashtrapatni'. Speaking in Lok Sabha, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "Sonia Gandhi, you sanctioned the humiliation of Droupadi Murmu. Sonia ji sanctioned humiliation of a woman in the highest constitutional post." Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also spoke in the Parliament asking him to apologise for his remark.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: No question of apologising, mistakenly said 'Rashtrapatni': Cong MP on remark on President
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday said that there is no question of apologising, claiming that he had mistakenly referred to President Droupadi Murmu as "Rashtrapatni". He added, "Now if you want to hang me for it, then you can...the ruling party, in a deliberate design, is trying to make a mountain out of a molehill."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I'll apologise to President, why is Sonia Gandhi being dragged in it?: Cong MP Adhir
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Thursday said, "I can't even think of insulting the President. It was just a mistake. If the President felt bad, I will personally meet her and apologise." He added, "They can hang me if they want. I am ready to get punished but why is she (Sonia Gandhi) being dragged in this?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP MPs circled Sonia like a pack of hyenas: Moitra on Sonia-Smriti spat
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra, while addressing the verbal exchange between Congress President Sonia Gandhi and BJP leader Smriti Irani, said that BJP MPs circled Gandhi like a pack of hyenas. "They had all surrounded her and were shouting at her. How can a 75-year-old in a mask be intimidating to anyone?" Moitra asked.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: ₹29 crore cash, 5 kg gold found at another house of TMC Minister's aide Arpita Mukherjee
text: The Enforcement Directorate has found ₹29 crore in cash and 5 kg gold from another house of West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee near Kolkata. The recovery comes days after the ED seized ₹21 crore in cash from another location linked to Mukherjee. Partha Chatterjee and Arpita Mukherjee were arrested in teachers recruitment scam.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Theft at Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's house, locals thought it is ED raid: Report
text: A theft was reported at West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's house in South 24 Parganas on Wednesday night. Reports said four masked miscreants came in a mini-truck and looted several items including furniture. Reports added that initially the locals mistook the thieves as another raid by the Enforcement Directorate, which earlier arrested the minister in an alleged teachers recruitment scam.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Will adopt Yogi's model in Karnataka if required: CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the state will adopt his UP counterpart Yogi Adityanath's model to deal with communal forces if required. In Karnataka, there are many regulating mechanisms, but if the need arises, Yogi's model would be taken up, he said. This comes after a BJP Yuva Morcha worker was killed by two bike-borne attackers in Dakshina Kannada.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TMC now only chants 'money' instead of 'Maa, Maati, Manush' slogan: BJP
text: BJP criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's alleged involvement in the SSC scam and asked why is Banerjee silent in the matter. "I want to remind the people...that those who used to raise the slogan of Maa, Maati, Manush, today they are chanting only one word - money, money, money," BJP's Meenakashi Lekhi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: He said that deliberately, repeated twice: Goyal on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's claim that he made the 'Rashtrapatni' remark by mistake, is false, as he said it "deliberately" and "repeated it twice". "This country will never tolerate this insult to our tribal people. After all that, he says that there is no need to apologise for this," Goyal added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Public is seeing your conduct: Union Minister to suspended MPs on protest
text: As 20 Rajya Sabha MPs, who were suspended for creating ruckus, are holding a 50-hour-long protest, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said public is seeing their conduct when the government is ready for discussion. "This isn't right," he added. "Sit here from morning to evening, then go home...take rest. Come back the next day and then continue your protest," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Suspended RS MPs continue 50-hr relay protest, spend night at Parliament complex
text: The suspended Rajya Sabha MPs continued their 50-hour-long relay protest as they were seen sitting near the Gandhi statue in the Parliament complex on Thursday morning. They spent the first night inside the Parliament complex on Wednesday as part of their protest against their suspension. "21 hours done, 29 hours to go," TMC’s Derek O’Brien tweeted on Thursday morning.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Deliberate sexist insult: Sitharaman on Adhir Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Union Finance Minister on Thursday said that it was a "deliberate sexist insult". "Sonia Gandhi should apologise to the President of India and the country," Sitharaman added. "In every way, Congress party has been attempting to undermine a tribal, self-made and successful leader," she stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He didn't even get chance to speak in Parliament: Cong leader on Adhir's remark
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu, party leader Gurjeet Singh Aujla said he has already apologised for his statement. "The government doesn't have anything to say in the Parliament...they are making an issue of his statement," Aujla added. "He (Adhir) did not even get a chance to speak in the Parliament," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He has already apologised: Sonia on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: After several BJP leaders demanded an apology from Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury for his ‘Rashtrapatni’ remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said he has already apologised. Earlier today, Chowdhury said, “There is no question of apologising. I had mistakenly said ‘Rashtrapatni’...the ruling party…[is] trying to make mountain out of a molehill.”
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He was our only son, culprits should be hanged: Deceased BJP youth worker’s mother
text: The mother of BJP Yuva Morcha worker Praveen Nettaru, who was hacked to death in Karnataka, has demanded strict action against the culprits, saying that the killers should be hanged. "He was our only son and had planned to build a home for us. Now, who'll build it?...Culprits should be punished, whoever did this must be hanged," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi should apologise for appointing someone like Adhir: Union Minister
text: Following Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury’s ‘Rashtrapatni’ remark for President Droupadi Murmu, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Thursday said that he should immediately apologise for his remark. "Sonia Gandhi should also apologise for appointing someone like him," Joshi added. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also spoke in the Parliament asking him to apologise.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Adhir's remark on President shameful, Congress should apologise: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu is "most shameful and condemnable". "Congress should abandon its casteist mindset," Mayawati tweeted and asked the party to apologise for Chowdhury's remark. Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha witnessed protests by BJP members against Chowdhury's remark today.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: No question of apologising, 50-hr-long protest by MPs to continue: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Mausam Noor on Thursday said that the 50-hour-long protest staged by the MPs against their suspension from the Rajya Sabha will continue. "There’s no question of apologising. We want to have discussions on price rise...but we were suspended," she added. This comes after Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that their suspension can be revoked if they apologise.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Union Minister seeks NIA probe into K'taka BJP youth leader's murder
text: Union Minister Shobha Karandlaje has written a letter to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking NIA probe into Karnataka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru's murder. In her letter, Karandlaje blamed organisations like Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) for Nettaru's murder. She further accused them of trying to disrupt the harmony in Dakshina Kannada district.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: When BJP was in Oppn, they said creating ruckus is part of democracy: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday said it’s their right to raise issues in the Parliament. "Back when the BJP was in the Opposition, they would say that creating ruckus is also part and parcel of democracy. Now, they are asking us to apologise," he added. "When we don't even get a chance, some [people] cause ruckus," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 3 more RS MPs suspended, taking total number of suspended MPs in Parliament to 27
text: Three more Rajya Sabha MPs, including AAP MPs Sushil Kumar Gupta, Sandeep Pathak and Independent MP Ajit Kumar Bhuyan, were suspended on Thursday for remainder of this week for disrupting House proceedings, Deputy Chairman Rajya Sabha Harivansh Narayan Singh said. Total 27 MPs, including 23 Rajya Sabha MPs and four Lok Sabha MPs, have been suspended during ongoing monsoon session.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray celebrates 62nd birthday with party workers at Matoshree
text: Shiv Sena party chief Uddhav Thackeray, who turned 62 on Wednesday, celebrated his birthday with party workers at his residence Matoshree in Bandra East. This is an annual ritual of the party but it was disrupted for the last two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Shiv Sainiks from across Maharashtra brought flowers, garlands, bouquets, posters, etc for Uddhav.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Congress maliciously targeting President: Irani on Adhir's 'Rashtrapatni' remark
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani criticised Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's 'Rashtrapatni' remark for President Droupadi Murmu by saying that his remark humiliates the dignity of that highest constitutional post. "Ever since Droupadi Murmu was nominated for the Presidential post she has been targeted maliciously by Congress and the attacks don't seem to stop even after she is elected," she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Partha should be removed from all party posts immediately: TMC’s Kunal Ghosh
text: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Thursday said West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee should be removed from ministry and all party posts immediately. "He should be expelled," he added. "If this statement is considered wrong, the party has every right to remove me from all posts," he stated. On Wednesday, Ghosh said Chatterjee's arrest brought "shame to all of us".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Adhir Chowdhury's remark anti-tribal, anti-women: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan called Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury's remark against the newly-elected President of India, Droupadi Murmu, "anti-tribal" and "anti-women". "He has insulted the highest office of the country with his statement. This is a manifestation of the worst mentality of him and his party," Chouhan tweeted. "Congress has [always] exploited tribal society," he added.
author: Swati Dubey
